variables.label: Version Tag
variables.description: Check out their documentation for the valid tags https://github.com/linuxserver/docker-openvscode-server/#version-tags

variables.label: Timezone
variables.description: Timezone for the application, find yours at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

variables.label: User ID
variables.description: User ID that the process uses, run (id $user) on your instance to see the ID

variables.label: Group ID
variables.description: Group ID that the process uses, run (id $user) on your instance to see the ID

variables.label: Connection Token
variables.description: Security token for accessing the Web UI. Should only contain alphanumeric characters or _, -. Leave empty to disable.

variables.label: Connection Secret
variables.description: Optional path to a file inside the container that contains the security token for accessing the Web UI (ie. /path/to/file). Overrides Connection Token. Leave empty to disable.

variables.label: Sudo Password
variables.description: User will have sudo access in the terminal with the specified password. Leave empty to disable.

variables.label: Sudo Password Hash
variables.description: Sudo password via hash (takes priority over Sudo Password). Format is "$type$salt$hashed". Leave empty to disable.

instructions.start:
OpenVSCode Server provides a version of VS Code that runs a server on a remote machine and allows access through a modern web browser.
It's based on the very same architecture used by Gitpod or GitHub Codespaces at scale.
instructions.end: OpenVSCode Server has been successfully deployed! It might take few moments before it's fully started. Please turn on "Websocket Support" in the settings. You can access it at http://$$cap_appname.$$cap_root_domain If you are using a connection secret or connection token, append ?tkn=$$cap_openvscode_server_connection_token to the URL.

description: A version of VS Code that runs a server on a remote machine and allows access through a modern web browser.
